column2: ITP approved for use by: Victor Mira
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Structural Fill Material shall meet the following requirements:
○ Permeability > 10-7m/s to allow consolidation (where <10-7 m/s, drainage layer or geonet to be provided)
FREQUENCY: Once per material type prior to commence of works
VERIFYING DOCUMENTS: ConQA Hold Point Release
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Survey pegs in place and clearly marks out the limits of the Works.

ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Earthworks shall be finished to conform to the levels, lines, grades and cross sections specified or shown on the relevant Ground Improvement drawings within the following limits:
○ For Scale C: No point of subgrade surface shall be more than 10mm above or 30mm below the specified level.
VERIFYING DOCUMENTS: Sign ITP, Survey Pick Up Report
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: DCP test to be carried out on the excavated surface to confirm the strength of the existing material is in accordance with Deisgn values for relevant chainages as below.
RESPONSIBILITY: Third party Geotech Engineer /SE/Site Supervisor
VERIFYING DOCUMENTS: ConQA Hold Point Release, Test Report
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Excavated subgrade to be compacted and proof rolled before any construction.
○ Withstands Test rolling without visible deformation or springing.
○ No fill to be placed until the area has been reviewed and approved.
○ If Proof Roll fail go to section 4.4
VERIFYING DOCUMENTS: ConQA Hold Point Release
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Geotechnical Engineer shall inspect founding material.

○ Any areas in Ground Improvement footprint where proof roll test or bearing capacity are inadequate crushed rock shall be placed and compacted into the excavated surface under direction from geotech engineer
Attach: Geotechnical Field Sheet or Report
VERIFYING DOCUMENTS: ConQA Hold Point Release, Geotech Report
REFERENCE: Section 204.10 (d) (ii) IFC Report and Drawings
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Fill material shall be spread and compacted in layers not exceeding 200mm compacted thickness. Extent of fill placement to be as per IFC Report and Drawings
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Each layer of fill shall be keyed into the layer above by creation of a textured surface.
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Withstands Test rolling without visible deformation or springing. No fill to be placed until the area has been reviewed and approved.
VERIFYING DOCUMENTS: ConQA Hold Point Release
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Each Lot to be tested for compaction as Scale C requirements (3 tests per lot)
○ Lot = One day's production or 5,000m2, whichever is the lesser
FREQUENCY: Each Lot unless otherwise directed by Nominated Authority
VERIFYING DOCUMENTS: Sign ITP, Compaction Test Report
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: The top of the subgrade surface shall be prepared to level and shape to produce a smooth, hard, tightly bound surface, free from depressions capable of holding water.
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Scale C: Tolerance: No point surface shall be more than 10mm above or 30mm below the specified level
VERIFYING DOCUMENTS: This ITP, Survey Conformance Report
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Ensure that any NCRs pertaining to the lot / element / Work area that this ITP covers, have been closed.
FREQUENCY: Once, prior to closure of this lot / element / Work area

On behalf of Metropolitan Roads Program Alliance, it is hereby certified that the Works represented by the item of work listed have been tested in accordance with the Project Quality Plan and conform in all respects with the requirements of the Contract.
